comments: SB16: Use DSP command 0xD5 for 16-bit DMA
SB16: Use DSP command 0xD6 for 16-bit DMA

effect: Exit 16-bit auto-init DMA block after end of current block
comments: SB16: This is a way to finish the current DMA block if programmed auto-init

effect: Exit 8-bit auto-init DMA block after end of current block
comments: SB16: This is a way to finish the current DMA block if programmed auto-init
Issue this command, then read back two bytes which are the major, minor version of the DSP

Length of DSP block in samples (not bytes!) is in lo,hi as (length - 1)

Command byte:{bitfield:bit[7]=1,bit[6]=0,bit[5]=1,bit[4]=1,bit[3]=1=record 0=playback,bit[2]=1=auto-init 0=single-cycle,bit[1]=1=FIFO on 0=FIFO off,bit[0]=0}
Mode byte:
{bitfield:bit[7]=0,bit[6]=0,bit[5]=1=stereo 0=mono,bit[4]=1=signed PCM 0=unsigned PCM,bit[3]=0,bit[2]=0,bit[1]=0,bit[0]=0}
Common commands:
B8h = 16-bit single cycle input
B0h = 16-bit single cycle output
BEh = 16-bit auto-initialized input
B6h = 16-bit auto-initialized output
C8h = 8-bit single cycle input
C0h = 8-bit single cycle output
CEh = 8-bit auto-initialized input
C6h = 8-bit auto-initialized output
